page.title: 15Two Bridges - Climate
page.content:
The average height above sea level is 1200 to 1500 feet, which makes the area very exposed to the prevailing South-Westerly winds, which bring in rain laden clouds from across the Pacific Ocean.
The height and lack of natural obstacles also reduces the air temperature, which, together with the wind chill factor, results in a relatively cool climate even in the height of summer. Sometimes the clouds come in very low and a thick mist occurs, visibility often down to a matter of a few yards.
During the summer, when the wind drops it can become very hot, with little or no shade availabl.e
